text: This list is an listed by number list of members of the United States House of Representatives from Alaska's at-large congressional district, making it from the state of Alaska. For by time tables of members of both houses of the United States Congress from the state (through the present day), look at the page United States congressional delegations from Alaska. The list of names should be complete (as of January 3, 2015), but other data may be not complete. It includes members who have represented both the state and the territory, both past and present. == Current member == There is only one district, making there only be one member: * Mary Peltola (D), since 2022 == List of members and delegates == Member Party Years District Residence Electoral history Democratic – January 3, 1959 Juneau Elected in 1944. Retired to run for U.S. Senator. Democratic – December 29, 1972 Anchorage Elected in 1970. Went missing and was said to be dead. Independent – March 3, 1909 Fairbanks Elected in 1906. Retired. Democratic – January 3, 1945 Valdez Elected in 1932. Retired. Democratic – March 1, 1921 Juneau Elected to finish Sulzer's term. Lost election voting. Democratic – present Bethel Elected to finish Young's term. Incumbent. Republican – January 3, 1971 Anchorage Elected in 1966. Retired to run for Governor of Alaska. Democratic – December 30, 1966 Fairbanks Elected in 1958. Lost re-election, then resigned. Democratic – January 7, 1919 Prince of Wales Island Elected in 1916. Lost election voting. – April 28, 1919 Elected in 1918. Died. Republican – March 3, 1931 Juneau Elected in 1920. Retired. Democratic – March 3, 1907 Nome Elected in 1906. Retired. Republican – March 3, 1917 Fairbanks Elected in 1908. Lost re- election. – March 3, 1919 Successfully contested Sulzer's election. Lost re- election. – March 3, 1921 Successfully contested Grigsby's election. Retired. – March 3, 1933 Juneau Elected in 1930. Lost re-election. Republican – March 18, 2022 Fort Yukon Elected to finish Begich's term. Died. == Related pages == * List of United States senators from Alaska * United States congressional delegations from Alaska * Alaska's congressional districts == References == Category:United States representatives from Alaska
title: List of United States representatives from Alaska
